meanings.definition: In a standoffish manner; aloof or reserved in behavior.
meanings.sent1: She stood standoffishly at the edge of the party, avoiding eye contact.
meanings.sent2: He always behaves standoffishly towards new colleagues, making them feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: The cat watched standoffishly as the dog tried to play with a toy.
meanings.sent4: The clouds hung standoffishly in the sky, refusing to give way to the sun.
meanings.sent5: The teacher looked standoffishly at the students misbehaving in the back of the class.

meanings.definition: Showing a reluctance to engage or interact with others.
meanings.sent1: The standoffishly cat hid under the bed whenever visitors came over.
meanings.sent2: She gave a standoffishly polite smile, but didn't join in the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed standoffishly uninterested in sharing its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood standoffishly apart from the rest, as if guarding a secret.
meanings.sent5: The new student sat standoffishly in the back of the class, observing everyone quietly.
